name: Way of the Long Death
description: Monks of the Way of the Long Death study the mechanics and meaning of dying. Their martial arts are influenced by their experiments with death, leading to a deadly fighting style.

touch_of_death.description: Extract vitality from creatures near death.
touch_of_death.effect: When you reduce a creature within 5 feet of you to 0 hit points, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Wisdom modifier + your monk level (minimum of 1).

hour_of_reaping.description: Unsettle or terrify those around you.
hour_of_reaping.effect: As an action, each creature within 30 feet of you that can see you must make a Wisdom saving throw or be frightened until the end of your next turn.

mastery_of_death.effect: When reduced to 0 hit points, you can expend 1 ki point to instead have 1 hit point.

touch_of_the_long_death.description: Channel death’s energy through your touch.
touch_of_the_long_death.effect: As an action, touch one creature within 5 feet and expend 1 to 10 ki points. The target makes a Constitution saving throw, taking 2d10 necrotic damage per ki point spent on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.
